answerText: inert pair effect [10] Atomic radius increases when going down and to the left on the table. Pairs of atoms that lie one below and one to the right of each other tend to share similar qualities, and are said to have this relationship.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 16 | 8 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Name some unusual phenomenon that may or may not be explained by the periodic table, for 10 points each.  [10] This effect is the reason why the most common oxidation states for thallium and lead are plus one and plus two respectively, two lower than the rest of their families. No theory explaining this effect has been fully accepted.
